docs.title: Dokumentasi Proyek
docs.text: Selamat datang di dokumentasi resmi proyek ini. Dokumentasi ini menyediakan panduan mulai dari instalasi, setup, dan cara penggunaan pada proyek.

docs.title: 🚀 Quick Start
docs.text:
Untuk memulai dengan cepat:

  1. Instalasi: Ikuti Panduan Instalasi
  2. Konfigurasi: Lihat Panduan Konfigurasi
  3. Tutorial: Mulai dengan Tutorial Dasar

docs.title: 🔧 Fitur Utama
docs.text:
• Performance Tinggi: Dioptimalkan untuk kinerja maksimal
  • Mudah Digunakan: Interface yang intuitif dan dokumentasi lengkap
  • Extensible: Mudah dikustomisasi dan diperluas
  • Cross-platform: Mendukung berbagai platform

docs.title: 📋 Persyaratan Sistem
docs.text:
• OS: Windows 10+, macOS 10.14+, Linux (Ubuntu 18.04+)
  • Memory: Minimal 4GB RAM
  • Storage: Minimal 1GB ruang kosong
  • Network: Koneksi internet untuk instalasi dependency

docs.title: 🆘 Dukungan
docs.text:
Butuh bantuan? Ada beberapa cara untuk mendapatkan dukungan:

  • 📖 Baca FAQ untuk pertanyaan umum
  • 🐛 Laporkan bug di Issues
  • 💬 Diskusi di Forum Komunitas
  • 📧 Email: support@example.com

docs.title: 📈 Changelog
docs.text: Lihat CHANGELOG.md untuk informasi tentang pembaruan terbaru dan perubahan versi.

docs.title: Index
docs.text: Instalasi

docs.title: Panduan Instalasi Grafana
docs.text: Grafana adalah platform open-source untuk monitoring dan observability yang memungkinkan Anda memvisualisasikan metrics, logs, dan traces dari berbagai sumber data.

docs.title: Daftar Isi
docs.text:
• Install Grafana on Ubuntu/Debian
  • Configure Grafana

docs.title: Install from APT repository
docs.text:
Method Description GET :material-check: Fetch resource PUT :material-check-all: Update resource DELETE :material-close: Delete resource

If you install from the APT repository, Grafana automatically updates when you run apt-get update.

Grafana Version Package Repository Grafana Enterprise grafana-enterprise https://apt.grafana.com stable main Grafana Enterprise (Beta) grafana-enterprise https://apt.grafana.com beta main Grafana OSS grafana https://apt.grafana.com stable main Grafana OSS (Beta) grafana https://apt.grafana.com beta main

docs.title: 1. Install the prerequisite packages:
docs.text: sudo apt-get install -y apt-transport-https software-properties-common wget

docs.title: 2. Import the GPG key:
docs.text:
sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings/
wget -q -O - https://apt.grafana.com/gpg.key | gpg --dearmor | sudo tee /etc/apt/keyrings/grafana.gpg > /dev/null

docs.title: 3. To add a repository for stable releases, run the following command:
docs.text: echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/grafana.gpg] https://apt.grafana.com stable main" | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/grafana.list

docs.title: 4. To add a repository for beta releases, run the following command:
docs.text: echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/grafana.gpg] https://apt.grafana.com beta main" | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/grafana.list

docs.title: 5. Run the following command to update the list of available packages:
docs.text:
# Updates the list of available packages
sudo apt-get update

docs.title: 6. To install Grafana OSS, run the following command:
docs.text:
# Installs the latest OSS release:
sudo apt-get install grafana

docs.title: 7. To install Grafana Enterprise, run the following command:
docs.text:
# Installs the latest Enterprise release:
sudo apt-get install grafana-enterprise

docs.title: Configuration file location
docs.text:
The default settings for a Grafana instance are stored in the <WORKING DIRECTORY>/conf/defaults.ini file. Don’t change this file.

Depending on your OS, your custom configuration file is either the <WORKING DIRECTORY>/conf/custom.ini file or the /usr/local/etc/grafana/grafana.ini file. You can use a custom configuration path with the --config option.

docs.title: Linux
docs.text: If you installed Grafana using the deb or RPM packages, then your configuration file is located at /etc/grafana/grafana.ini and a separate custom.ini is not used. This path is specified in the Grafana init.d script using --config option.

docs.title: Docker
docs.text: Refer to Configure a Grafana Docker image for information about environmental variables, persistent storage, and building custom Docker images.

docs.title: Grafana Cloud
docs.text: There is no local configuration file for Grafana Cloud stacks, but many of these settings are still configurable. To edit configurable settings, open a support ticket.

docs.title: Remove comments in the .ini files
docs.text:
Grafana uses semicolons (;) to comment out lines in the INI file. To uncomment a line, remove the semicolon (;) from the beginning of that line.

Grafana ignores all configuration lines that begin with a semicolon.

For example:

# .ini
;http_port = 3000

docs.title: http_addr
docs.text:
The host for the server to listen on. If your machine has more than one network interface, you can use this setting to expose the Grafana service on only one network interface and not have it available on others, such as the loopback interface. An empty value is equivalent to setting the value to 0.0.0.0, which means the Grafana service binds to all interfaces.

In environments where network address translation (NAT) is used, ensure you use the network interface address and not a final public address; otherwise, you might see errors such as bind: cannot assign requested address in the logs.
